Satay Kajang

Satay (/ˈsɑːteɪ/ SAH-tay)

Some facts about Satay:

  • Satay is a seasoned, skewered, and grilled beef meal served with a sauce from Southeast Asia.
  • In Malaysia, satay can be found throughout all the states of Malaysia in restaurants and on the street, with hawkers selling satay in food courts and nightmarket
  • Well-known satay outlets are mostly from Kajang and the city is known as 'Sate City'.
  • In the Kajang area, stalls and restaurants provide not only the more classic chicken or beef satay, but also more unusual meats like venison, rabbit, or fish, as well as gizzard, liver, and a variety of other options.
  • Extra information:
    • There are other types of satay that are well known in other states in Malaysia such sate lok-lok from Penang and sate celup or dip satay from Malacca.
    • Satay is well-known and served in several other countries such as in Indonesia, Netherlands, Philippines, Singapore, Sri Lanka and Thailand.
